articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Djibouti President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Djibouti President
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Ismail Omar Guelleh, president of Djibouti, on its 34th  independence day.
					Kim in the message wished the President and people of Djibouti greater successes in the work for development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 He also hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Congratulates Portuguese PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Congratulates Portuguese PM
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on June 24 sent a congratulatory message to Pedro Passos Coelho on his appointment as Prime Minister of Portugal.
					 The message wished him success in his work for development and prosperity of the country. 
					
					 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Paulo Portas on his appointment as foreign minister of Portugal.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Anti-Reunification Remarks Slammed
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Anti-Reunification Remarks Slammed
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea recently told gentries of the Advisory Council of Democracy and Peaceful Unification at Chongwadae that "unification can come at midnight like a burglar". He also called for getting prepared for unification, saying it came near. 
					 Papers of the DPRK in commentaries Sunday brand his remarks as an intolerable insult to the Koreans desirous of reunification and an unpardonable politically-motivated provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says that Lee has done nothing for reunification except pushing the inter-Korean relations to a catastrophe to delay it. He dared to defile the arduous struggle fought by Koreans for reunification and the noble self-sacrificing spirit displayed by them.
					
					 The said remarks can be made only by a die-hard confrontation maniac, a lunatic seeking division only.
					
					 "Unification" touted by Lee is not the independent and peaceful reunification to be achieved by the concerted efforts of the Koreans but "unification of systems" premised on toppling the DPRK. Herein lies the gravity of his remarks.
					
					 Lee fully revealed his true colors as a traitor seeking the confrontation of systems by doggedly standing against national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, it is a pipe dream to try to expand the corrupt fascist dictatorial system of south Korea to the DPRK through the confrontation of systems.
					
					 Minju Joson says that the traitor compared reunification to a burglar only to reveal the poor level of his thinking as a political imbecile and philistine and the nature of human scum accustomed to lining one's pocket with others' cash.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Abolition of S. Korea's NSL
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Abolition of S. Korea's NSL
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea should abolish the "National Security Law" (NSL), urged Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Sunday.
					 The article warned that the group will be doomed to final ruin if it persists in confrontation with fellow countrymen through enactment of the "North Korean Human Rights Act" while refusing to repeal the NSL despite the strong domestic and foreign demand.
					
					 The NSL has been used as a means for "security of power" and human rights abuses by the successive south Korean rulers for more than 60 years, it noted, adding:
					
					  It is a bad law unprecedented in the history of world's legislation in light of the circumstances of its enactment and the process of its retrogressive revision.
					
					 This is the fascist law ruthlessly violating democracy and human rights and a basic means used by the south Korean present conservative regime to keep power and bolster its dictatorial system.
					
					 The abolition of the law is an urgent task of the times for south Korea.
					
					 However, the Lee group set up again a section specializing in the cases of violation of the NSL, saying it is immature to abolish the law. The group is also indiscriminately suppressing organizations and people struggling for national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the Lee group has worked hard to railroad the "North Korean Human Rights Act" through the "National Assembly", talking about someone's "human rights issue" while downplaying serious human rights abuses it committed by dint of the NSL.
					
					 This clearly proves how reckless the group has gone to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen and achieve its ambition for "unification of systems".
					
					 The NSL has no justification to exist any longer in the present times as it antagonizes fellow countrymen and incriminates the struggle for national unity and reunification.

articles.title: Anti-"government" Struggle in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"government" Struggle in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Banking Union under the south Korean Federation of Trade Unions held a mammoth rally at the plaza of the Seoul City Office on June 22 to denounce the puppet government for bringing the banking business to catastrophe and posing a grave threat to the life of workers.
					 Attending it were more than 20,000 unionists serving in the finance field including banks across south Korea.
					
					 Ri Yong Duk, chairman of the federation, Kim Mun Ho, chairman of the Banking Union, Ri Jong Hui, representative of the Democratic Labor Party, and others spoke at the rally.
					
					 They charged that from the very day of its seizure of power the Lee Myung Bak group did not hesitate to name its aides to major posts at its own will in a bid to have monopoly over the financial circle.
					
					 They declared that they would stage a general strike against the "government" bringing the banking business to ruin and forcing the submission on workers.
					
					 They stated that they would surely punish the dictatorial forces in the next year's elections.

articles.title: Seminars Held Abroad to Mark Important Anniversary of DPRK
articles.content:
Seminars Held Abroad to Mark Important Anniversary of DPRK
						
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A national seminar of Juche idea study organizations in Uganda took place at Kyambogo University on June 17 to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 On display at the hall of the seminar under the theme of "Single-minded unity of Korea based on the great Juche idea" were photos on Kim Jong Il's feats and books and photos introducing the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were Baguma Isoke, director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, chiefs and members of Juche Idea study organizations and teachers and students of the university.
					
					 Auma-Okumu, head of the Juche Idea Group of the Department of Psychology of the Kyambogo University, stressed the need to zealously follow the valuable experience of the WPK which achieved single-minded unity of the whole party and society by giving priority to ideological work, guided by the great Juche idea. 
					
					 Speakers at the seminar praised the single-minded unity of the Korean society based on the Juche idea and the invincible might of the WPK.
					
					 In another development the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea held a joint seminar on June 16 in celebration of the above-said anniversary and Kim Jong Il's historic visit to China. 
					
					 Secretary General Medhane said that Kim Jong Il's recent visit to China further consolidated the traditional DPRK-China friendly relations provided by President Kim Il Sung. This made an immortal contribution to peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia and, furthermore, the rest of the world, he added.

articles.title: Events Held Abroad to Mark Significant Anniversary of DPRK
articles.content:
Events Held Abroad to Mark Significant Anniversary of DPRK
						
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between June 8 and 19 to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 They included seminars, film shows and photo exhibitions in Russia, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, Myanmar, the Czech Republic, Cambodia, Germany and Mongolia.
					
					 Displayed in their venues were works of Kim Jong Il and photos showing his undying Songun leadership feats. 
					
					 Koreans films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Pyongyang at Night".
					
					  Kim Jong Il, possessed of distinguished leadership ability, has led the army and people to the struggle for defending socialism under the banner of Songun, said the chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia at a seminar.
					
					 Under his leadership the Korean People's Army has grown to be an invincible army armed with the steadfast spirit of defending socialism and modern military equipment, she noted.
					
					 The chairman of the External Relations Commission of the People's Party of Cambodia said that his party rejects the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and fully supports the DPRK's efforts for durable peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The chief of the Franken Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Germany said that the U.S. which resorts to high-handed and arbitrary practices in international arena, too, dare not provoke the DPRK under the Songun policy of Kim Jong Il. Korea's reunification is sure to be realized when all Koreans advance under the banner of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, he added.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at seminars in Russia and Germany.

articles.title: Anniversary of Inter-Korean Declaration Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Inter-Korean Declaration Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted articles on their homepages on June 15 and 19 to mark the 11th anniversary of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					The International Alliance posted photos of General Secretary Kim Jong Il receiving ex-President Kim Dae Jung and a delegation of media organizations of south Korea and an article, which said:
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration, adopted at the north-south summit in June 2000, solemnly clarified the principle of achieving Korea's reunification by its nation itself.
					
					 Its adoption marked a new milestone for struggle to realize the country's reunification, the long-cherished desire of the entire Korean nation.
					
					 The inter-Korean summit evoked a great sensation from among the south Korean public. 
					
					 But the present authorities of south Korea persistently stand against the implementation of the joint declaration, the article said, calling for continued action of rejecting traitor Lee Myung Bak's anti-reunification moves. 
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee, in an article posted on its homepage, elaborated on the fact that "By our nation itself", the idea of national independence and great unity and peace, has served as an eternal banner of Korea's reunification.

articles.title: Foreign Newspapers on Kim Jong Il's Feats
articles.content:
Foreign Newspapers on Kim Jong Il's Feats 
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries carried special write-ups on the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The Guinean paper Horoya on June 14 carried photos of his revolutionary activities and devoted a whole page to a commemorative article.
					
					 The paper described the history of Kim Jong Il's leadership over the party as that of a genuine statesman who serves the people.
					
					 The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on June 15 carried a portrait of Kim Jong Il. In an article the paper praised him for consolidating the single-minded unity of the Korean society with his distinguished leadership ability and policy of love and trust for the people.
					
					 The June 13th issue of the Ugandan paper Sun Rise and the June 14th issue of the Nepali paper Majodur said that Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into an ever-victorious party and the motherly party absolutely supported and trusted by the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Russia
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries brought out in booklet General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution".
					 The work, published on January 29, 2003, clarifies the idea that the Songun-based revolutionary line, the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea, is an effective political mode in the present era as it carried forward and developed President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of attaching importance to the arms.
					
					 Semyonov, chairman of the Association, said at a book-releasing ceremony on June 21 that the validity and vitality of the Songun politics are being further displayed day by day and that many countries would accept the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded in Czech Republic
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea and the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association jointly issued a bulletin on June 13 to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The bulletin praised Kim Jong Il as an extraordinary thinker-theoretician. 
					
					 The WPK, guided by the Juche idea fathered by President Kim Il Sung, has led the Korean people's efforts for building socialism to victory for several decades, it noted, adding that Kim Jong Il published many works to give perfect answers to theoretical and practical issues arising in party building.
					
					 Signal successes made in the DPRK clearly prove the great vitality of his ideas and theories, it said.
					
					 In an article titled "Kim Jong Il: Songun leadership and modern Korea" the bulletin dealt with world-startling events taking place one after another in the DPRK under his Songun leadership. 
					
					 In another article titled "Story about June 15" the bulletin told about the immortal feats performed by him to bring about the June 15 era of reunification.

articles.title: Newspaper "Banner of Paektu" Released in Russia
articles.content:
Newspaper "Banner of Paektu" Released in Russia
Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- The Tynda City Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of the Russian Philosophy Association released newspaper "Banner of Paektu" to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The paper carried in its front page a photo of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and articles under the headline of "Kim Jong Il: June 19, 1964".
					
					 Those articles praised the immortal feats of Kim Jong Il who has developed the WPK into the eternal party of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 In its second and third pages the paper carried panoramic view of the International Friendship Exhibition House, photos on the invincible might of the Korean People's Army and articles introducing the DPRK.
					
					 The paper in fourth and five pages edited a photo of Kim Jong Il watching opera "Evgeni Onegin" and photos and articles introducing the opera.
					
					 Its sixth, seventh and eighth pages carried photos and articles dealing with activities of Juche idea study organizations in Russia.

articles.title: Economic Depression in US and Japan
articles.content:
Economic Depression in US and Japan
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- U.S. existing-home sales dropped 3.8 percent in May from the previous month, the National Association of Realtors said in a report on June 21.
					 Current housing market activity indicates a very slow pace of broader economic activity.
					
					 Meanwhile, Japan's supermarket sales in May dropped 1.4 percent from a year earlier, said the Japan Chain Stores Association on June 22.

articles.title: Typhoon-5 Hits DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon-5 Hits DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Typhoon-5 Meari is moving northward at speed of 60 km per hour in the DPRK.
					 Strong wind of 10-13 m per second hit Haeju and Kaesong cities, Ongjin and Sepho counties and other areas from 03:00 to 09:00 Sunday.
					
					 Rainfall of 105 mm was registered in Hoeyang County, 90 mm in Kosong and Pongchon counties, 79 mm in Thongchon and Chongdan counties, 76 mm in Yonan County, 73 mm in Kosan County and 70 mm in Changdo County from 12:00 Saturday to 12:00 Sunday.
					
					 Tidal waves are foreseen to hit coastal areas of South Hamgyong Province and Kangwon Province on Sunday afternoon.
